column2: Big tech may halt earnings recession
column3: if it delivers third-quarter numbers NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Technology heavyweights might be all that keeps the U.S. earnings recession from extending into a fifth quarter in September if they hit the higher estimates Wall Street is calling for.

column2: UPDATE 1-NBC has sold $1.2 billion in Olympics advertising RIO DE JANEIRO Aug 4 NBC
column3: a unit of Comcast Corp
column4: has sold $1.2 billion in advertising for the Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro
column5: the network said on the eve of a rare Games where some of the most high-profile contests will air live in prime time for U.S. audiences.

column2: Power company Duke Energy's profit falls on impairment chargeUPDATE 2-Duke Energy targets deal for overseas assets by year-end Aug 4 Duke Energy Corp reported a higher-than-expected quarterly profit
column3: helped by strength in its regulated power business
column4: and said it was working with selected bidders to sell its international assets.  UPDATE 2-Duke Energy targets deal for overseas assets by year-end Aug 4 Duke Energy Corp reported a higher-than-expected quarterly profit
column5: helped by strength in its regulated power business
column6: and said it was working with selected bidders to sell its international assets. Aug 4 Duke Energy Corp
column7: the biggest U.S. power company by generation capacity
column8: reported a 6.3 percent fall in quarterly profit
column9: hurt by an impairment charge related to certain assets in Central America.UPDATE 2-Duke Energy targets deal for overseas assets by year-end Aug 4 Duke Energy Corp reported a higher-than-expected quarterly profit
column10: helped by strength in its regulated power business
column11: and said it was working with selected bidders to sell its international assets.

column2: BRIEF-EOG Resources posts Q2 shr loss $0.53; keeps FY capex forecastUBS wins dismissal of securities fraud lawsuit over Enron collapseUPDATE 2-EOG boosts fracking plans even with oil price at $40 HOUSTON
column3: Aug 4 Shale oil bellwether EOG Resources Inc on Thursday boosted this year's fracking plans by 30 percent
column4: saying it expected big returns on new wells even as oil dipped back to $40 a barrel.  UPDATE 2-EOG boosts fracking plans even with oil price at $40 HOUSTON
column5: Aug 4 Shale oil bellwether EOG Resources Inc on Thursday boosted this year's fracking plans by 30 percent
